ISSUE.TITLE: Password attempt failure Lock-out set to 30 minutes (compliance with PCI DSS 3.2 requirements)
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Requirement 8.1.7: Password attempt failure Lock-out set to 30 minutes minimum. (may be an admin configured setting). User accounts be locked out after not more than six invalid logon attempts. Without account-lockout mechanisms in place, an attacker can continually attempt to guess a password through manual or automated tools (for example, password cracking), until they achieve success and gain access to a userâ€™s account. But we already have CAPTCHA. Why should we do it? setting: Maximum login failures to lockout account. Set 0 to disable this feature. default: 6 setting: Lockout time (minutes). default: 30 Source: http://www.nopcommerce.com/boards/t/38848/nopcommerce-380-roadmap-and-estimated-release-date-lets-discuss.aspx?p=5#159909 [PCI_DSS_v3-2.pdf](https://github.com/nopSolutions/nopCommerce/files/351713/PCI_DSS_v3-2.pdf) Also see related items - https://github.com/nopSolutions/nopCommerce/issues/2009 and https://github.com/nopSolutions/nopCommerce/issues/2010
